To help you anticipate and navigate all that television has to offer across broadcast, cable and streaming, TVLine offers daily, weekly and monthly What to Watch digests, as well as an overview of every new TV show premiering in 2025.

This week, youâ€™ll find a dozen series debuts (including Wynonna Earpâ€™s Melanie Scrofano in Revival, and True Bloodâ€™s Stephen Moyer in Art Detectives), seven returning shows (including The Real Housewives of Miami and The 1% Club, now hosted by Joel McHale), and a dozen finales (including Pat Sajakâ€™s final spin on Celebrity Wheel of Fortune) and more.

Want scoop on any of the following shows? Email usÂ and your question may be answered in Mattâ€™s Inside Line.

The docuseries follows four adults who have yet to experience sexual intercourse, as they navigate love, intimacy and self-discovery in their 30s and 40s.

Five close friends navigate life, love and the challenges that come with divorce, marriage and dating.Â

The docuseries goes inside the suspected killerâ€™s home, where never-before-seen testimony from his own family unravels a chilling portrait of a man accused of living a double life and hiding dark secrets under their own roof.

Each episode in this weekly docuseries focuses on some of the wildest and most bizarre events ever to blow up in mainstream media, starting with the 2021 Astroworld tragedy.

ğŸ“º 10 pm 1000-lb Roomies (TLC)
Larger-than-life roommates Nesha and Jazz tackle life, love and losing weight as they bond over food and their shared love of Jazzâ€™s daughter, Nana.
